34305.title: :Full Stack Developer (34305)
34305.description:
Our client is looking for a Full stack developer for a Hybrid contract in Toronto. The Banking client has a new concept for its mobile/web app ready for implementation. You’ll help plan the implementation and build key features for a new page within the app.

Responsibilities

  • Implement front-end features and responsive UI for mobile/web (accessibility-compliant)

  • Integrate with back-end APIs; manage sessions, errors, and RBAC

  • Contribute to CI/CD pipelines and version control practices

  • Work across the SDLC (design ? build ? test ? release) in Agile/Scrum

  • Collaborate with designers, product, and platform teams

Required Qualifications (3–5+ years)

  • Front-end: Angular, HTML, CSS, JavaScript; responsive development; WCAG 2.x / AODA

  • Back-end: Node.js; API integration (REST/GraphQL), JWT, OAuth 2.0

  • Dev practices/tools: Git/GitHub, CI/CD (Jenkins or Azure DevOps), Docker, Postman

  • Security & app concerns: RBAC, error handling, session management

  • Familiarity with GitHub Copilot or similar AI coding tools

  • UI libraries: Bootstrap, Material UI

  • SDLC experience; Agile/Scrum delivery

Nice to Have

  • React exposure, banking/financial services experience

34307.title: QA Engineer   QA Developer (34307)
34307.description:
Our client is looking for a QA developer for a hybrid contract to support a new mobile/web app page rollout for a major Canadian bank. You’ll plan test strategy and execute manual + automated testing across UI, API, and responsive layers, ensuring accessibility and quality for a fast-moving product build.

Project Background

  • New concept for the bank’s mobile app is ready for implementation.

  • You’ll help plan the implementation and validate features/functionality that will live on the new mobile/web app page.

Responsibilities

  • Define and execute test strategies, test plans, and test cases (manual & automated).

  • Perform API testing, web responsive testing, regression, and accessibility checks (WCAG).

  • Create automation scripts; integrate with CI workflows; log/track defects and drive resolution.

  • Partner with product, design, and engineering in an Agile/Scrum environment; report test outcomes.

Required Qualifications (4–5+ years)

  • Hands-on manual & automation testing (UI + API).

  • Web responsiveness testing; solid test strategy creation and execution.

  • Accessibility (WCAG) testing exposure.

  • Familiar with GitHub Copilot or similar AI coding tools.

  • Comfortable across the SDLC (design ? planning ? execution).

Tech & Tools

  • Automation: Selenium; JUnit/TestNG (or equivalent)

  • API: Postman, SoapUI

  • Responsive testing: BrowserStack, LambdaTest

  • Test Management/Defect: TestRail, Jira, qTest

  • Accessibility: Lighthouse (or equivalent)

  • Methodology: Agile/Scrum

32657.title: Technical Manager Customer Support (32657)
32657.description:
Our client is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Technical Support Manager to lead a team of skilled Technical Support Engineers in delivering world-class customer support. This individual will be responsible for managing daily support operations, coaching and mentoring team members, driving operational excellence, and fostering a customer-first culture focused on satisfaction, retention, and long-term success.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in technical support operations, experience with networking or SaaS platforms, and a genuine passion for solving customer issues with empathy and urgency.

Core Responsibilities

  • Lead, inspire, and develop a team of Technical Support Engineers to deepen product knowledge, elevate support standards, and encourage professional growth.

  • Oversee daily operations of the support organization, ensuring key performance indicators (KPIs)—including customer satisfaction, response time, and resolution rate—are consistently met or exceeded.

  • Serve as the primary escalation point for complex or high-priority technical issues, ensuring timely and effective resolution.

  • Analyze support metrics, service-level agreements (SLAs), and customer feedback to identify trends and implement scalable improvements that enhance team efficiency and service quality.

  • Evaluate and adopt new tools and technologies that improve productivity and the overall customer support experience.

  • Foster employee development and retention through regular coaching, mentoring, and opportunities for continuous learning.

  • Drive consistency in support processes by promoting best practices, standardizing workflows, and maintaining high-quality documentation.

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, and Customer Success, to address systemic issues and advocate for long-term product improvements.

  • Lead customer-facing support reviews and Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs) to discuss issue trends, resolutions, and opportunities for service enhancements.

  • Translate technical feedback and customer pain points into actionable improvements for product development and documentation.

Required Qualifications and Skills

  • 7+ years of experience in technical support or customer success, including managing technical escalations.

  • Proven success leading support teams in fast-paced, high-growth environments.

  • Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving abilities.

  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

  • Solid understanding of networking concepts and tools used for troubleshooting network-related issues.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related technical field (or equivalent professional experience).

  • Ability to prioritize and manage multiple initiatives in a high-pressure environment.

  • Demonstrated ability to proactively identify risks and implement effective mitigation strategies.

34296.title: Quality Lab Tech Sampler (34296)
34296.description:
QA Lab Technician Sampler
Onsite - Ada, MI
Contract - $16/hr. W2

Clover Consulting (a Myticas Company) has a large, direct client in Ada, MI seeking a QA Lab Technician Sampler. This is an hourly paid position on a W2 contract. Initial contract terms is 6 months, with GREAT potential for multi-year extension/s.

Description:

The sampling position would include sampling all raw material and packaging components in several warehouses. The raw material sampling would include materials that are used in the cosmetic and home care products, as well as materials that are used in the food industry including allergens. The packaging components would be sampled in the warehouse and this would include inspecting the shipment for defective components.

The materials that are sampled are logged in the QA data system where sampling data is entered. The samples are then delivered to the respective labs including micro, chemistry and packaging. This is NOT a QA laboratory job but may lead to opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Requirements:

- A valid State of Michigan driver’s license. Candidate will be driving around complex.
- Basic computer skills.
- Science background or science degree is preferred but not required.

34299.title: Data Scientist Engineer (34299)
34299.description:
Myticas's direct client is seeking Data Scientist/Engineer at Waukegan, IL (Hybrid – 3 days onsite).
Duration: 4 Months Contract (Possible further extension)

Must-Have Skills Set/Experience:
1. Proficiency in SQL and Python programming. R programming is a plus
2. Ability to work with “big data” and practiced in exploratory data analysis
3. Strong experience as a data engineer
4. Knowledge of statistical methods, machine learning, natural language processing
5. Good communicator. Good presentation skills

Job Description:
The successful Data Scientist/Engineer will translate business needs into analytic questions; conduct data exploration and model specification; mange data flows and ETL operations; visualize data into dashboards; design and perform analyses of operational, transactional, and log data; and translate these analytic findings into leading information and metrics for our business partners. The chosen candidate would be able to take on responsibilities spanning multiple disciplines across data engineering, data science and analytics programming.

Job Responsibilities:
• Consult with internal and external stakeholders to determine how best to apply analytical solutions that support business objectives
• Work closely with product managers, analysts, and other stakeholders to provide reliable data deliverables
• Build and maintain scalable data pipelines. Develop, optimize, and manage ETL processes for structured and unstructured data
• Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and security across various platforms
• Implement data quality checks and monitor pipeline performance
• Collaborate in cloud environments (e.g., AWS, Cloudera, Dataiku, etc.) and with big data technologies (e.g., Spark, Hadoop)
• Demonstrate a basic knowledge of data science related concepts (i.e. predictive analytics, unsupervised learning, machine learning, deep learning) and how to use them for solving real world problems
• Adhere to agile project management frameworks and set the direction of data science initiatives
• Effectively communicate technical concepts to a non-analytic audience

Required Qualifications/Experience:
• Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, or related field with ?3 years of relevant professional work experience with an outstanding track record
• Proficiency in Python and SQL is required. Knowledge of R programming is a plus.
• Practical experience with data science techniques and toolkits, including times series forecasting, machine learning, deep learning, and LLMs
• Familiarity with navigating in both a relational (Teradata-based) and non-relational (Hadoop) environment. Knowledge of Java/Scala/Apache Spark is a bonus
• Practiced in exploratory data analysis (EDA) and manipulating large data sets
• Good interpersonal skills and ability to present technical concepts to business stakeholders
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Self-starter and intellectually curious with a strong desire to improve business processes through innovation
• Motivated to gain the full business understanding behind each analytical request

34291.title: Records Technician (34291)
34291.description:
Records Technician
Location: Marysville, OH
Pay: $23.50 / hr

Responsibilities
  • Under general supervision, responsible for supporting Records Management with established processes.
  • The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data processing, and advanced Excel spreadsheet formula experience as well as PowerBI.
  • This role will involve analyzing large datasets, creating detailed reports, and providing actionable insights to support business decisions.
  • Occasional support of pickup, delivery of retrieved records and sending offsite records for Client departments.
  • Ensuring chain of custody is followed and maintain the confidentiality of records as well as updating the location of records in the system.
  • Provide support prepping and quality checking records as required.
  • Verify and document records stored by following established cataloging system.
  • Assist with digitizing, retrieving and working closely with Department Records Representatives to retrieve and store department records.
  • Assist with physical records management by ensuring inventory accuracy, analyzing large datasets, and support the disposal process of records eligible for destruction.
  • Develop and maintain complex Excel spreadsheets, including advanced formulas, pivot tables, and macros.
  • Provide support / guidance for delivery and pick-up of records with current vendors.
  • Able to manage their own project load, multitask & prioritize accordingly.
  • Ensure Departments are following the Company Policy on Document Retention and maintain Confidentiality of documents

Qualifications
  • High School diploma.
  • Minimum of 3 years in a professional office environment.
  • Analytical skills with the ability to use O365 for data analysis and research.
  • Able to meet deadlines and understand time issues.
  • Prioritize and work with co-workers, supervisors, and customers.
  • Resolve customer issues and take responsibility for work performed.
  • Knowledge of records software systems, scanners, filling, storage and disposal procedures.
  • Expert proficiency in computer skills, especially when using records tracking system or quick retrieval filling & storage of files
  • Proficiency in MS Excel, Pivot Tables, Formulas, PowerBI
  • Good communication skills (written, read, and verbal)

Physical Demands:
  • Physical Activity required, including bending, reaching, lifting, and prolonged periods of standing.
  • May lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.

34248.title: Content Annotation Specialist (34248)
34248.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Wichita, KS, is seeking a Content Annotation Specialist for a hybrid contract position.

Shift Time: 8-5 and 30-40 hours per week

NOTE: W2 Only!

Job Responsibilities:

The position will be utilizing marked up Word documents to analyze changes from prior versions and template version to determine the changes needed to integrate the new version of dynamic forms within an audit "title" for approximately 20 titles. Candidates should be familiar with Word and Excel. Basic understanding of XML is recommended but not required. Must be able to quickly adapt to new systems. High-level attention to detail is a must. Needs ability to produce quality output under tight deadlines. Receive on-the-job training and direction from more experienced staff to ensure requisite learning is achieved and utilized to complete assignments. Business knowledge of auditing is a bonus.


Required Skills/Experience/Qualifications:
• Bachelor’s degree.
• Analytical and detail-oriented mindset.
• Strong organizational skills and proficiency with Microsoft Office 365 suite.
• Familiarity with content management systems.
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
• Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
• Flexibility, responsiveness to change, and a proactive attitude.
• Able to adhere to production and process standards within a content team.

34300.title: Security Architect (34300)
34300.description:
Responsibilities
  • Lead the design, development, and implementation of secure network and infrastructure architectures.
  • Assess current security posture and provide recommendations for improvements across network, cloud, and hybrid environments.
  • Define and document security architectural standards, roadmaps, and reference models.
  • Collaborate with solution architects, infrastructure teams, and business stakeholders to ensure security is embedded in all technology solutions.
  • Evaluate emerging security tools, technologies, and processes for enterprise adoption.
  • Conduct threat modeling, risk assessments, and gap analyses for new and existing systems.
  • Ensure compliance with security standards, regulatory requirements, and best practices (NIST, ISO 27001, CIS, Zero Trust).
  • Support incident response planning and provide architecture guidance during investigations.


Experience/Skills:
  • 8+ years of progressive IT experience with a focus on security architecture and network security.
  • Expertise in designing secure architectures for enterprise networks, cloud (AWS, Azure, or GCP), and hybrid environments.
  • Hands-on knowledge of firewalls, IDS/IPS, VPNs, Zero Trust frameworks, micro-segmentation, and secure network protocols.
  • Familiarity with SIEM, IAM, endpoint security, and encryption technologies.
  • Strong understanding of compliance/regulatory frameworks (PCI-DSS, SOX, GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).
  • Proven experience working in large enterprise or public-sector environments.
  • Certifications such as CISSP, CCSP, SABSA, TOGAF, or vendor-specific security certifications are considered assets.
  • Excellent communication skills with the ability to present security recommendations to both technical and executive audiences.

34286.title: Document Control Assistant (34286)
34286.description:
Document Control Assistant
Location: Kansas City, MO
Pay Range: $22.00-$26.00/hr.
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, and 401(k)

The Document Control Assistant will assist the document control team and Project Managers to deliver quality materials and input information on engineering projects.

  • Responsible for setting up on multiple small projects; assist on medium and larger sized projects as needed.
  • Collaborates to set up the standards and procedures for the team.
  • Communicates document system procedures with team members.
  • Coordinates documents with multiple engineers for project needs.
  • Compiles electronic project data books.
  • Issues transmittals to clients and vendors.
  • Processes vendor submittals.
  • Packages electronic documents for clients, vendors, and internal needs.
  • Notifies appropriate person of troubleshooting issues regarding vendors and clients.
  • Monitors workflows for the project team.

Requirements:

  • 2 Years College (Minimum) / Associates
  • 3 years’ applicable experience
  • MS programs, SDx, Procore, Aconex
  • Required knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Access.
  • Accurate data entry skills.
  • Archiving and Research experience.

34304.title: SAP RTR FICO Lead – Toronto (34304)
34304.description: Our client, Insurance sector, is looking for a Lead SAP FICO consultant

34293.title: Project Manager (34293)
34293.description:
We are seeking an experienced Project Manager to oversee the planning, execution, and delivery of technology projects that align with organizational objectives and government standards. The Project Manager will ensure integration across technical solutions, monitor industry trends, and support the adoption of emerging technologies while managing resources, schedules, risks, and stakeholder communication. This role requires Canadian Government Secret Clearance at minimum.

Key Responsibilities

  • Project Planning & Strategy: Develop project plans, frameworks, and delivery strategies to meet business and application requirements.

  • Policy & Compliance: Identify policies, standards, and requirements that guide project execution and ensure compliance.

  • Solution Analysis: Coordinate the evaluation of alternative technology solutions to resolve business challenges.

  • Integration Oversight: Ensure project deliverables support the integration of all aspects of technology solutions.

  • Trend Awareness: Monitor industry and government technology trends to ensure projects remain aligned with future directions.

  • Innovation Support: Provide direction on incorporating emerging technologies within project scope.

  • Impact Assessment: Oversee impact analysis of proposed technology or project changes on timelines, scope, and resources.

  • Team Support: Collaborate with technical teams to ensure projects leverage existing infrastructure effectively.

  • Quality Assurance: Review designs, deliverables, and outcomes to ensure adherence to standards and recommend improvements.

  • Executive Reporting: Prepare reports, briefings, and presentations for senior leadership and project stakeholders.

  • Leadership & Mentorship: Coach, mentor, and guide project teams to foster collaboration, accountability, and knowledge transfer.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Project Manager, Program Manager, or in a leadership role overseeing technology projects.

  • Strong understanding of IT infrastructure, solution delivery, and enterprise systems.

  • Demonstrated ability to manage complex projects with multiple stakeholders in government or regulated environments.

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies, cloud platforms, and IT governance standards.

  • Exceptional communication and presentation skills with experience engaging senior leadership.

  • Strong leadership, mentoring, and team-building capabilities.

  • Must hold active Canadian Government Secret Clearance.

Preferred Skills

  • Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or equivalent.

  • Experience with Agile, Waterfall, or hybrid project management methodologies.

  • Experience working on Government of Canada IT projects or in regulated industries.

  • Knowledge of compliance, data security, and federal IT standards.

34295.title: Senior Automation & Controls Engineer (34295)
34295.description:
Senior Automation & Controls Engineer
Location: Kansas City, MO (On-site/field)

Benefits: Access to Clients Benefits Package

Description:

The Senior Automation & Controls Engineer leads and executes Automation and Controls Engineering design activities for minor to major scale Engineering, Procurement, and Construction (EPC) projects in food, consumer products, pharmaceutical, life science, aerospace and industrial facilities. Responsible for executing automation and controls deliverables for project(s) in the front end, detailed design, construction, and start-up phases. Projects range from controls projects working directly for the client to control self-execution on full-scale Automation and Controls EPC projects.

Responsibilities:

  • Design responsibility for all Automation and Controls scope on the project.
  • Leads a team of Automation and Controls Engineers, Specialists, and Designers in the execution of design. Interfaces with a multi-faceted project team internally consisting of project manager, electrical, controls, estimating, procurement, construction, and other engineering disciplines.
  • Responsible for leading and developing software design deliverables including PLC and HMI programming design deliverables as well as Batch, MES, servers and virtualization.
  • Responsible for commissioning and startup of those design deliverables.
  • Lead and prepare controls design deliverables, including instrument/device list, I/O list, controls narratives, control panel and controls hardware design, device location plan drawings and installation details.
  • Lead the specification, design, and procurement activities for control panel and equipment vendors, manage vendor progression, and lead the Factory Acceptance Tests (FATs).
  • Lead and prepare electrical design deliverables including 480VAC and below equipment and motor power design, installation plan drawings, and conductor schedules.
  • Determine process instrument measurements protocols, such as temperature, pressure, flow, level, analyzers, and control valves. Utilize knowledge of various technologies for selecting the appropriate controls application.
  • Experienced in reviewing P&IDs and working with process engineers to define and show proper controls scope of the project.
  • Develop and manage verification of design, calculations, project studies and report preparation.
  • Interfaces directly with offsite design office and coordinates and tracks execution of controls deliverables to that office.
  • Responsible for leading and performing quality reviews of project design submittals and coordinating those reviews within the department.
  • Responsible for applying knowledge of commonly used automation and controls engineering/design concepts, principles, practices, codes, and procedures within the engineering services industry.
  • Interfaces directly with construction personnel in development of contracts and execution of work.
  • Develops project estimates at each project phase through various software such as Proposal works, Integrated Architecture Builder (IAB), SIL Solver, Bluebeam, Excel, and Visio.
  • Supports project manager in the development and tracking of automation and controls project budgets and expected progress.
  • Works with clients and vendors directly in developing design. Build effective relationships with existing clients, customers and contractors and develop new business opportunities. Responsible for ensuring customer satisfaction goals and expectations are met. Have a list of clients that frequently request them for projects or assistance.
  • Provides leadership, technical direction and development to Automation and Controls team members.
  • Assists in the day-to-day allocation of resources to their projects.
  • Coordinate with field personnel to resolve design related installation issues, calculations, field inspections and testing of controls systems.
  • Responsible for leading the technical execution and team during onsite start-up and commissioning activities.
  • Responsible for developing and submitting discipline change notices as needed to the project management team.
  • Fully understands and can execute the EPC project approach.
  • This position will require making trips to job sites to survey, support installations, and lead startups
  • Work with our business development team to identify and develop key projects and customer pursuits.
  • Frequently attends and hosts client events.
  • Develop business strategies for future projects. Understands business needs and profitability factors.
  • Reviews and develop engineering hour estimates and proposals for all phases of the project.
  • Supports interviewing and hiring process for new team members.
  • Coordinates workload with Automation and Controls Department Manager.

Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in Controls, Electrical, Mechanical or Chemical Engineering, or related degree and successful completion of Fundamentals of Engineering (FE) exam
  • 7+ years electrical engineering experience. (6 years with a Masters Degree)
  • EPC project and Automation 7 Controls experience are preferred.
  • Experience with leading the discipline design for large projects and delegating work tasks to team members.
  • Ability to lead execution of work and resolve issues in a team environment.
  • Demonstrated critical thinking skills, ability to work methodically and analytically in a quantitative problem-solving environment.
  • Strong attention to detail, facilitation, team building, collaboration, organization and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to perform quality reviews for detailed engineering documents and specifications.
  • Must have or be able to obtain a Transportation Worker Identification Card (TWIC).
  • Professional Engineer (PE) License Preferred

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

32532.title: SAP PPDS Consultant (32532)
32532.description:
Our client, a global consulting leader, is seeking a highly experienced SAP PPDS (Production Planning and Detailed Scheduling) Consultant for a remote contract engagement.

Responsibilities:

  • Provide expert guidance and configuration support for SAP PPDS

  • Utilize planning heuristics, optimizers, and interactive tools to drive production and scheduling processes

  • Support detailed scheduling and background planning activities

  • Maintain pegging relationships and monitor production alerts

  • Collaborate with project teams and stakeholders to ensure timely execution

Requirements:

  • 10+ years of experience in SAP PPDS

  • Strong experience in process manufacturing industries (preferred)

  • Experience with S/4HANA ePPDS (bonus)

  • Proficiency in:

    • Production planning heuristics/optimizer

    • Interactive planning and scheduling tools

    • Detailed scheduling heuristics/optimizer

    • Pegging relationships and Alert Monitor

Additional Information:

  • Fully remote opportunity

  • Candidates must provide a LinkedIn profile link with their application

  • Competitive rates encouraged

34285.title: Infrastructure Manager  - Linux Subject Matter Expert (34285)
34285.description:
The Manager will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.
Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.
Key Responsibilities
  • Act as the primary technical expert for Linux-based HPC clusters – ensuring performance, capacity, and availability targets are met.
  • Identify, diagnose, and resolve complex second-level issues for hardware, software, network, VPN, and Linux environments; escalate as needed with full documentation.
  • Manage daily operations of Linux-based HPC environments, including patching, upgrades, security hardening, and configuration of Ubuntu and RedHat systems.
  • Support job submission and workload management using Slurm or OpenHPC, and assist end users in optimizing compute workloads.
  • Migrate existing nodes to Linux, ensuring minimal downtime and performance impact.
  • Implement and manage cluster patching/automation tools such as Foreman (or similar) to streamline operations.
  • Install and configure servers, storage, hypervisors (KVM), and other HPC infrastructure components.
  • Automate administrative tasks to improve operational efficiency.
  • Execute firewall access requests, monitor security alerts, and assist in incident response.
  • Provide second-level support and mentorship to junior technical staff, ensuring knowledge transfer and consistent process execution.
  • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.
  • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.
Education & Experience
  • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).
  • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.
  • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.
Specialized Skills
  • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.
  • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.
  • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.
  • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.
  • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).
  • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).
  • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.
  • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.
  • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.
  • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.
Decision Making & Supervision
  • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.
  • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.
Working Conditions
  • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).
  • Requires appropriate security clearance.
  • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.
Published Job Description
  • Published Job Description
The HPC Administrator will serve as a Linux Subject Matter Expert (SME), responsible for monitoring, maintaining, troubleshooting, and supporting high-performance computing (HPC) nodes that are critical to our client’s day-to-day operations. The role focuses on ensuring a secure, optimized, and highly available HPC environment, while delivering deep technical expertise and guidance to users and internal teams.
Candidates must be able to work onsite at least 4 days per week.

    • Develop, maintain, and publish technical documentation, KB articles, and end-user guides for new systems or upgrades.
    • Participate in on-call rotations, emergency incident response, and occasional after-hours maintenance windows.
Education & Experience
    • Diploma or Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
    • Minimum 2+ years in IT (with a related University Degree) or 7+ years in IT (with a three-year College Diploma).
    • Enterprise-level Linux expertise (Ubuntu and/or RedHat) is essential.
    • Certifications (e.g., MCSE, CISSP) are strong assets.
Specialized Skills
    • Proven track record as a Linux SME in installation, tuning, and operational support.
    • In-depth experience with HPC clusters and job scheduling tools such as Slurm, LSF, or GridEngine.
    • Strong knowledge of KVM or similar hypervisors.
    • Working understanding of network systems, protocols, and standards including Active Directory integration.
    • Identity management experience (Microsoft Identity Manager, Azure AD Connect).
    • Solid scripting skills (Bash required; additional scripting languages are an asset).
    • Experience applying advanced troubleshooting to resolve performance, configuration, or security issues.
    • Excellent problem-solving, organizational, and documentation skills.
    • Ability to communicate clearly with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
    • Bilingualism (English/French) is an asset.
    • Microsoft Windows knowledge is an asset.
Decision Making & Supervision
    • Operate with minimal supervision while making decisions based on analysis, troubleshooting, and established procedures.
    • Coordinate with helpdesk, networking, platform, and security teams to ensure alignment of upgrades, patches, and operations.
Working Conditions
    • Comfortable office environment with periodic physical tasks (e.g., installing hardware).
    • Requires appropriate security clearance.
    • Must be willing to provide occasional off-hours support and participate in on-call rotation.

34289.title: Lab Quality Control Technician (34289)
34289.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Quality Control Lab Technician for a 6 months contract. Extensions are likely up to 3 years. This is an on-site role.

XS Energy Quality Control Lab Technician
What is special about this role:

As a XS QA lab technician, you will ensure XS Energy Drinks meet the chemical specification requirements by performing Wet Chemistry and Sensory testing. You will have responsibilities related to testing and evaluation, investigation support, laboratory maintenance, environmental monitoring, and other duties. As a part of the high functioning team, you will work in both group and autonomous circumstances while working on-site together. Your ability to work collaboratively will be valued in this role as you work with cross-functional peers in quality and manufacturing to ensure product quality.

Roles & Responsibilities:
• Conduct quality testing on in-process and finished product in the XS plant • Assay and sensory analysis of liquid CO2
• Testing includes use of titrators, density meters, x-rays, and other general laboratory equipment
• Perform taste/odor/appearance evaluation on samples throughout production
• Work both independently as well as with manufacturing
• Communicate with manufacturing when in-process adjustments are required
• Maintain laboratory work area and assist with general laboratory cleaning
• Inventory management Skills to be successful in this role:
• Experience with performing wet chemistry, physical, sensory tests, and can seam testing
• Attention to detail to follow standard operating procedures, safety requirements, test procedures and current good manufacturing practices (cGMP)
• Ability to offer recommendations for continuous improvements
• Talent to prioritize work effectively and complete work efficiently meeting high quality standards
• A desire for a sense of ownership and to be an ambassador of Quality to
Manufacturing

Hours of Operation:
• 1 st shift: 6am-4:30pm Monday-Thursday

34292.title: Technical Architect (34292)
34292.description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Technical Architect to design and implement robust technology architectures, frameworks, and strategies that align with business objectives and application requirements. The successful candidate will evaluate solutions, ensure integration across systems, and provide leadership in adopting emerging technologies, while mentoring and guiding teams to build sustainable and scalable solutions. This role requires Canadian Government Secret Clearance at minimum.

Key Responsibilities

  • Architecture & Strategy: Develop technical architectures, frameworks, and strategies to address organizational and major application needs.

  • Policy Alignment: Identify and interpret the policies, standards, and requirements that influence solution design.

  • Solution Evaluation: Analyze and assess alternative technology solutions to determine the most effective approach to business challenges.

  • Integration Leadership: Ensure seamless integration of all components within technology solutions.

  • Trend Monitoring: Stay current with industry and government technology trends to align solutions with evolving directions.

  • Innovation & Emerging Tech: Provide insight, direction, and support for the adoption of emerging technologies.

  • Impact Analysis: Conduct impact assessments of proposed technology changes on systems and operations.

  • Support & Guidance: Collaborate with application development and technical support teams to ensure optimal use of infrastructure.

  • Standards & Performance: Review application and infrastructure designs for compliance with standards, recommending enhancements for performance and scalability.

  • Executive Communication: Assist in the preparation of materials and deliver presentations to senior leadership as required.

  • Mentorship & Collaboration: Coach, mentor, and collaborate with colleagues to enhance organizational capability in architecture and solution development.

Qualifications

  • Proven experience as a Technical Architect, Solutions Architect, or related senior technical role.

  • Strong knowledge of enterprise architecture frameworks, IT standards, and best practices.

  • Expertise in analyzing complex business problems and designing scalable technology solutions.

  • Familiarity with emerging technologies, cloud computing, integration platforms, and IT governance.

  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with experience influencing senior leadership.

  • Demonstrated ability to mentor, coach, and collaborate effectively across teams.

  • Must hold active Canadian Government Secret Clearance.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience working in public sector or regulated industries.

  • Knowledge of compliance, data security, and government IT standards.

  • Professional certifications in architecture (e.g., TOGAF, Zachman, AWS/Azure Architect) are an asset.

34280.title: Sr Java AWS Developer (34280)
34280.description:
Title: Sr Java/AWS Developer
Location: Chicago, IL 60604 (On-site Work)
Duration: 12 Months Contract with Possible Extension

NOTE: Looking for W2 candidates only.
  • Candidate must be USC or GCH (At least 2 years of US resident after receiving Green Card), requires ANACI clearance

Required top 3 hard skills:
  • Full Stack Java Developer (Java, Angular, AWS and RDS)
  • Bachelor's degree in a technical field such as computer science, computer engineering or related field required
  • 7-10 years’ experience required.

Job Description:
One of our direct clients is looking for a Sr. Full Stack Java Developer (Java, Angular, AWS and RDS).

Principal Duties and Responsibilities:
• Hands on experience in developing and successful deployment of large scale projects from end-to-end.
• Evaluates, designs, and implements complex modifications to existing applications to accommodate changes in user requirements of hardware/software infrastructure
• Collaborates with Project Management, Business and Systems Analysts and leadership by recommending specifications for system enhancements for continuous functional improvement
• Produces technical documentation that accurately and thoroughly depicts the software design and code base
• Maintains robust understanding of business processes and needs in order to deliver accurate solutions
• Develops, maintains, and enhances high quality software code in accordance with established organization standards and development guidelines
• May review, perform testing, and provide feedback on the work of Application Developers
• Provides primary or backup support to resolve production problems and processing issues
• Hands-on experience in following the iterative and agile SDLC process.
Must have experience building public facing applications using:
• Object Oriented Analysis and Design
• AWS Services - Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, VPC, API Gateway, ECR , RDS
• CICD Pipeline
• Terraform
• Typescript
• Java, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Hibernate, Rest API\
• Docker
• RDBMS
• Git

34279.title: Senior Electrical Engineer (34279)
34279.description:
Senior Electrical Engineer
Location: Dallas / Fort Worth Area, TX (Hybrid)
Direct Hire
Rate: $50 - $98 / hr.
Benefits: Access to full company benefits package.

As a Senior Electrical Engineer in the Dallas Forth-Worth area, your primary focus will be on leading an electrical engineering team to provide advisory services and engineering design solutions for clients across all market sectors.

Responsibilities will include:

  • Collaboration with our Client Account Managers and Sales Professionals on pursuits of strategic importance to the firm.
  • Anticipating challenges and managing “up and out” while supporting large teams responsible for the daily details of project delivery.
  • Using highly collaborative and sophisticated communication and problem-solving skills.

What you’ll bring:

  • Bachelor's or Advanced Degree in Electrical Engineering, Electrical Power Engineering or related engineering discipline.
  • Professional Engineering licensure (any US state), with the ability to acquire a license in additional states if required for a particular project.
  • Minimum of 8 years of engineering design and/or consulting experience.
  • Power distribution systems and microgrids
  • Power generation projects exceeding 10MW capacity.
  • HV or MV Substations
  • Renewable energy projects including wind, solar, hydro, geothermal and other technologies.
  • Energy storage systems
  • Power system modeling experience using SKM Power Tools, ETAP or similar modeling software.
  • Protection and Control, SCADA or power system automation
  • Campus utility master planning or decarbonization/climate response planning
  • Cogeneration or combined heat and power systems
  • Thermal utility plants and distribution systems (steam, hot water, chilled water)
  • Proven ability to engage with clients, develop relationships and win work, then deliver innovative solutions providing value to both the client and provider.
  • Demonstrated ability to engage in business growth strategy, including exploration and development of new project opportunities, including knowledge and application of new and emerging technologies.
  • Experience with proposal development and project execution planning, including scope development and manhour estimates for engineering services.
  • Passion for mentoring and development of junior technical staff.
  • Strong communication and technical writing skills

Other Details:

  • Availability to travel as required to support project needs (varies by project but typically less than 50%)
  • Availability to work at least 2 days per week in the Fort Worth, TX office when not travelling.
  • US Citizenship is required for this position.

34287.title: Document Control Assistant (34287)
34287.description:
Document Control Assistant
Kansas City, MO

Pay Rate: $26.00/hr.
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, and 401(k)

The Document Control Assistant will assist the document control team and Project Managers to deliver quality materials and input information on engineering projects.

  • Responsible for set-up for multiple small projects; assist on medium and larger sized projects as needed.
  • Collaborates to set-up the standards and procedures for the team.
  • Communicates document system procedures with team members.
  • Coordinates documents with multiple engineers for project needs.
  • Compiles electronic project data books.
  • Issues transmittals to clients and vendors.
  • Processes vendor submittals.
  • Packages electronic documents for clients, vendors, and internal needs.
  • Notifies appropriate person of troubleshooting issues regarding vendors and clients.
  • Monitors workflows for the project team.

Requirements:

  • High School Diploma/GED
  • 3 years applicable experience
  • MS programs, SDx, Procore, Aconex
  • NOTE: Applicable experience may be substituted for the education requirement.
  • Required knowledge of Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, and Access.
  • Accurate data entry skills.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

34284.title: Staff Project Controls Specialist (34284)
34284.description:
Staff Project Controls Specialist
Location: Phoenix, AZ
Pay: $35 - $60 / hr
Benefits: Access to Benefits Package

The Staff Project Controls Specialist will be responsible for leading project controls processes with the internal project management team to execute project deliverables within budget and schedule.

  • Ensure project set-up in the Enterprise Planning & Controls software.
  • Analyze data, review logs, and run reports in the Enterprise Planning & Controls software or other tools. (Proficiency in Primavera P6 is desirable)
  • Create Work Breakdown Structure (WBS).
  • Develop, implement, and maintain effective scheduling reports, cost reports, cash flows and forecasts for multiple projects.
  • Follow project execution plans.
  • Responsible for engineering, procurement and construction planning, scheduling, logistics and cost control.
  • Serve as a point of contact for technical questions from the project team.
  • Approve Purchase Orders and/or Subcontracts for proper coding.
  • Input and document changes to cost reports or forecasts.
  • Interface with the Project Management Team and Accounting Department to review project costs and contingency costs and support external audits.
  • Review upstream (prime contract) and downstream (purchase order & subcontract) change orders.
  • Develop and present a cash flow report.
  • Develop various levels of schedules.
  • Perform field progress measurements.
  • Perform Earned Value measurements.
  • Maintain projects’ key performance Indicators.
  • Apply and review the entry of logic ties within the schedules.
  • Monitor resource loading of a schedule.
  • Support Project Planning Meetings.
  • Create various schedule reports and determine appropriate reporting format.
  • Develop, review, and analyze pre-programmed project scheduling reports and back-up documentation for accuracy.
  • Consult with the project team on schedule progress.
  • Analyze and evaluate schedule management involving the critical path method of scheduling techniques, estimating, project cost management and forecasting.
  • Perform schedule what-if scenarios.
  • Develop and maintain an earned value management system.
  • Input and validate progress measurement.
  • Develop and maintain progress curves.
  • Perform material takeoffs.
  • Perform quality checks and inspections on project controls deliverables.
  • Perform field audits to validate accuracy of reporting and processes.
  • Capable of assisting with Project Forensic Analysis.

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering, Construction management or related field.
  • 3 years of direct project controls experience.
  • Applicable experience may be substituted for the degree requirement.
  • Experience with Oracle Primavera P6 preferred.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills.
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office.
  • Proficient with PowerBi.
  • OSHA 10-hour safety certification OR the ability to obtain.

34075.title: Senior Data Warehouse Business Analyst (34075)
34075.description:
Clover Consulting (a Myticas Co.) has a direct client in Springfield, IL in need of a Data Warehouse BA for a REMOTE, long-term contract. Travel to Springfield may be required 2-4 times/year. Qualified candidates please provide resume.

Functional Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated Senior Business Analyst to support a large-scale Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) project. This role will serve as a critical liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, ensuring that data warehouse solutions align with business goals. This role involves gathering and translating business requirements into functional specifications, supporting data modeling efforts, and facilitating testing and validation of data warehouse deliverables.

Primary Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with business users, data engineers, and BI developers to define and document business and data requirements.
  • Analyze existing data sources and business processes to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
  • Translate business needs into detailed functional and technical specifications for data warehouse development.
  • Support the design and implementation of ETL processes, interfaces, data marts, reports, and data analytics.
  • Work with our testing team to develop and execute test plans to validate data accuracy and integrity.
  • Facilitate user acceptance testing (UAT) and ensure stakeholder sign-off.
  • Create and maintain documentation including data dictionaries, process flows, and reporting specifications.
  • Act as a subject matter expert on data warehouse capabilities and best practices.
  • Support change management and training efforts related to new data solutions.
Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher degree in business intelligence, analytics, computer science, engineering, or related STEM field.
  • 5+ years of healthcare business analysis experience supporting business initiatives through data analysis, writing business requirements and supporting testing of various systems.
  • Good understanding of Fee for Service (FFS), Managed Care claim adjudication processes from eligibility and enrollment to claims processing to funding/finance.
  • Experience working on a Medicaid Enterprise System (MES)/MMIS, or EDW DDI or equivalent.
  • Proficient in MS Word, MS Excel, MS Project, SharePoint, Teams, and MS PowerPoint.
  • Be a self-starter and able to thrive in an environment with little guidance.
  • Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.
  • Ability to effectively communicate findings clearly and concisely in writing and verbally to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Ability to work in a challenging environment with multiple teams and competing priorities
  • Experience with facilitating meetings.
  • Effective organizational, analytical, time management, problem-solving, and multi-tasking skills
  • Ability to complete assignments under tight deadlines with little/no direct supervision.

32659.title: Drupal Developer (32659)
32659.description:
<p>The recruitment team at Myticas Consulting is looking for an experienced Drupal Developer who would be interested in a long-term remote contract opportunity offered within Canada (originally headquartered in Ottawa, ON).</p>

<p><strong>Previous experience required:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Experience building web applications in the Drupal (7) CMS
	<li>Understands key server-side web development concepts through experiences such as:
	<li>Interpreting graphic visual or interaction designs in HTML, CSS and Javascript.
	<li>Creating visually appealing web pages or interfaces.
	<li>Creating, editing or modifying templates for a CMS or web development framework.
	<li>Programming interaction with JavaScript and/or a lipary such as jQuery, YUI or Prototype.
	<li>Testing cross-powser, cross-platform, and/or cross-device compatibility for inconsistencies.
	<li>Testing for compliance to specified standards such as accessibility standards (WCAG 2.0) in the clients region or domain.
	<li>Conducting observational user testing, or reviewing designs against usability heuristics.
	<li>Domain specific knowledge or transferable skills
	<li>Experience with web development languages of HTML, CSS and JavaScript/jQuery.
	<li>HTML
	<ul>
		<li>Familiarity of HTML syntax for multiple specifications, including HTML 5.
		<li>Knowledge of the semantic meaning of all HTML elements.
		<li>Familiarity with the semantic markup for display of lists, tabular data, forms, articles, etc.
		<li>Knowledge of markup used for layout such as dividers.
		<li>Knowledge at the level to be able to hand-code markup.
		<li>Including media and images.
	</ul>
	
	<li>PHP
	<ul>
		<li>Familiarity with modifying Drupal Theme hooks to display data
		<li>Understanding how to utilize PHP to filter, process and output html, json, xml
	</ul>
	
	<li>CSS
	<ul>
		<li>Specifying different CSS for various media, devices and displays.
		<li>Best practices in CSS file organization and structure.
		<li>Methods for including CSS inline, internal and external via linked style sheets.
		<li>How to define, combine and group CSS selectors for HTML elements, ID, classes, pseudo classes, child or sibling.
		<li>Syntax of CSS declarations, properties and attributes.
		<li>CSS box model and methods for CSS positioning, absolute and relative.
		<li>Knowledge of properties and attributes to control the display.
		<li>Familiarity with differences in CSS 2 and CSS 3.
		<li>Proficient with a CSS Preprocessor such as Sass or LESS.
	</ul>
	
	<li>Best practices
	<ul>
		<li>Drupal standards and modules
		<li>Methods to ensure powser & device compatibility
		<li>Methods for degrading gracefully for older powsers and displays.
		<li>Methods to ensure accessibility.
		<li>File compression techniques for improving speed.
	</ul>
	
	<li>JavaScript
	<ul>
		<li>Knowledge of the operators, variables, datatypes, objects, properties and methods.
		<li>Familiarity with control structures such as objects, functions, conditional statements, arrays, loops and expressions.
		<li>Forms and regular expression validation and submitting data.
		<li>Knowledge of how to apply logical operators and conditional statements.
		<li>Knowledge of the DOM HTML objects and their properties.
		<li>Event handling.
		<li>Creating and controlling windows and dialogs.
		<li>Processes for troubleshooting and debugging
		<li>Familiarity with development and debugging tools for cross-powser issues.
	</ul>
	
	<li>jQuery
	<ul>
		<li>Knowledge of how to employ the jQuery lipary for visual effects, event handling, and document manipulation.
	</ul>
	
</ul>

34278.title: Sr. Architect (34278)

34276.title: Site Management Supervisor (34276)
34276.description:
<p><strong>Site Management Supervisor</strong><br>
Location: Denver, CO / Hybrid</p>

<p>Rate: $57.69-$72.11/hr.<br>
Benefits: Medical, Dental, & Vision</p>

<p>**** This position includes a company vehicle with paid fuel. Candidate must be located within an hour of the Winter Park, CO area.</p>

<p><strong>Qualifications:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Candidate must have a Level “A” wastewater license for the state of Colorado.
	<li>High school diploma.
	<li>6 years’ experience at an industrial water/wastewater treatment facility, or municipal water/wastewater facility public works operation, including experience in project management with responsibility for technical support and financial accountability or 6 years working in a related field.
	<li>Understanding of industrial operations including basic fluid flow, process equipment, and control instrumentation.
	<li>Three years of experience at a supervisory level.
	<li>Ability to travel 10% of the time.
	<li>Possess a valid driver’s license with no major infractions.
	<li>Proficient with computer software including Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Teams), PDF software, etc.
	<li>Ability to perform daily computer skills managing various client software programs, SCADA, and data entry.
	<li>Possess sufficient virtual communication skills to successfully maintain operations and regulatory compliance while located remote from client sites.
	<li>Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, and abide by Industrial Regulations and Standards.
	<li>Candidate needs to be able to read, understand, abide by, and guide their team in compliance with client safety, quality, and other requirements.
	<li>Candidate must live in Winter Park, CO, or a nearby community
</ul>

<p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p>

<ul>
	<li>Manage staff for two locations in Colorado for a private-sector industrial client.
	<li>Organize and direct all onsite contract operations teams (projects) within the assigned portfolio.
	<li>Provide clients with effective performance in compliance with local, state, and federal regulatory agency water quality permit requirements.
	<li>Create a safe work culture and ensure safe work practices are followed by all staff.
	<li>Maintain assigned sites in Operational and Regulatory compliance.
	<li>Provide support, mentoring, training, and leadership to assure the highest possible effort on the part of onsite managers, local staff, and operators in the region.
	<li>Ensure staff stays on task and completes job related duties.
	<li>Assure personnel compliance with corporate reporting systems and customer reporting systems.
	<li>Lead O&M personnel development and training program to drive professional advancement within the organization.
	<li>Implement O&M training programs to develop all levels of associates at regional sites, recommend new training requirements, undertake to advance professional skills, mentor new project managers and members of the contract operating teams with a written plan.
	<li>Assure the implementation of all required training programs and performance reviews for new and existing projects.
	<li>Lead O&M Safety, Maintenance, Process Control, cost/savings, process optimization, and Sustainability efforts in the assigned portfolio.
	<li>Participate in the selection, assignment, and orientation of all onsite supervisors and motivate extraordinary, self-starting effort by onsite supervisors.
	<li>Support affirmative action and diversity efforts in the assigned portfolio.
	<li>Assure O&M management of the proper execution of job performance interviews and in the continuing communication of management policies to all personnel.
	<li>Develop all of the technical skills to function as an onsite manager and are prepared to perform these functions during project start up as well as during emergency situations.
	<li>Verify and complete all job-related documents and reports.
	<li>Maintain quality of operations and deliverables at the levels expected by client, including achievement of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) where applicable.
	<li>Frequently travel to sites for Client meetings, Inspections, and Operational Compliance.
	<li>Provide support with business development of contract operations and other efforts.
	<li>Report on all competitive contract services sales efforts and advises marketing personnel of these efforts and prepare other reports and presentations as required.
	<li>Provide primary client relationship with client management and technical personnel and report regularly as to client confidence, satisfaction, and/or problems.
	<li>Review monthly contract service reports for each installation, advising management as to project status, regulatory agency permit compliance, and technical/plant management attitudes.
	<li>Support regional personnel with the handling of local problems and in the development of client relations strategies to assure successful on-going business at each site.
	<li>Develop budgets and assist in the preparation of operations strategies to achieve compliance with regulatory agency requirements and O&M corporate objectives.
	<li>Review all monthly project reports and utilize these materials to more effectively manage O&M client services and to assure O&M's compliance with all contract provisions and client understanding and satisfaction of services rendered.
	<li>Actively participate in regional and local professional groups, and reports on any technology or service advancements desired by local groups and/or O&M clients.
</ul>

<p><em>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.</em></p>
